physdesc.label: Quantity
physdesc.extent: plus additions of .8 cubic ft. (2 boxes)

extref.corpname: University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee Libraries, Archives Department

did.abstract: This collection contains records of the Midwest Archives Conference (MAC) from the organization's founding in 1972 until the present. Included are records from MAC's presidents, secretaries and treasurers, council, committees, meetings, publications, public information officers, and audio-visual materials and memorabilia. The collection documents activities of this regional archival association, particularly issues of concern, such as the appointment of the Archivist of the United States, developments in the field of archives, and the organization's bi-annual meetings. Publications include complete sets of MAC newsletters (1973-present) and journal, the Midwestern Archivist (1976-1991) and Archival Issues (1992-present).

bioghist.p: The Midwest Archives Conference (MAC) was organized at a June 1972 meeting attended by 111 interested professionals. Since its founding the organization has grown into one of the largest regional archival associations in the country. Members include archivists, manuscript curators, librarians, records managers, historians, and allied professionals working in historical societies; local, state, and federal archives; college and university archives; religious archives; health science archives; and corporate archives. The MAC region covers thirteen states: Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, Nebraska, North Dakota, South Dakota, Ohio, and Wisconsin.
MAC holds an annual meeting in spring and a symposium in the fall in cities throughout the region. The organization publishes a quarterly newsletter and a professional journal.
For more information, please visit the Midwest Archives Conference Web site at: www.midwestarchives.org.

scopecontent.p: Scope and content notes for each record subgroup and/or series are included in the contents list.

arrangement.p: This collection was received in, and is organized in, multiple parts. Additional materials have not been physically or intellectually arranged and interfiled, and researchers may need to consult more than one part of the collection to locate similar materials.
The collection is arranged into the following record subgroups, and, unless specified, alphabetically by folder title and then chronologically within each record group.

item.ref: Accession 2013-051: Archival Issues Editorial Board Records, 2011-2014

otherfindaid.p: A spreadsheet with file-level information on the electronic records is available in the Archives Department. The spreadsheet contains information on file title (where applicable), author, dates created, modified, file formats, file size, and number of pages. Additional technical metadata is available; consult an archivist for more information.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material in the UWM Libraries

accessrestrict.p: The Accepted Journal Article Files are restricted for 15 years from the date of the review. Some of the Journal Editorial Board files which pertain to manuscript reviews are also restricted for 15 years. Access to these records will be available only to the current MAC Editorial Board chair.
Patrons must use digital access copies of the original VHS recordings.
There are no access restrictions on the remainder of the materials, and the collection is open to all members of the public in accordance with state law.

userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of libel, privacy, and copyright which may be involved in the use of this collection (Wisconsin Statutes 19.21-19.39).

acqinfo.p: The Midwest Archives Conference donated its records to the UWM Archives in January 2003. At that time, the collection was transferred from Northwestern University in Evanston, Illinois to the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee (accession 2002-070). The UWM Archives regularly receives additions to the collection. Information about these additions is available on request.

processinfo.p: After the collection arrived at UWM, Christel Maass processed the collection from February 2003 to November 2004, assisted by Andrew Blahnik, Ann Stachewicz, and Jesse Gant. As much as possible, the arrangement of the collection follows the order established by former MAC Archivist Patrick Quinn. In December 2010, Christel Maass processed some unnumbered accessions. In April 2011, Christel Maass processed accessions 2003-091, 2004-027, 2004-036, 2004-066, 2005-012, 2005-065, 2007-013, 2007-015, 2007-037, 2008-010, 2008-026, 2008-043. In fall 2013 and spring 2014, Emma Cobb (supervised by Michael Doylen) processed accessions 2005-068, 2006-061, 2007-002, 2007-024, 2007-063, 2010-055, 2011-051, 2012-041, 2013-025, and 2013-027. Charles Hosale (supervised by Christel Maass and Brad Houston) processed accessions 2004-059, 2004-060, 2005-057, 2006-060, 2010-049, 2012-042, 2012-055, 2013-29, and 2013-031. Hayley Jackson updated the finding aid to include information about accession 2013-051 in June 2014. Christel Maass added accession 2015-022 to the collection in December 2015.

processinfo.head: Preservation Information
processinfo.p: aul Eisloeffel at the Nebraska State Historical Society digitized the VHS recordings in 2015. Preservation master files were created as uncompressed stereo .avi files captured at 720x480. Access copies were created as compressed 640x480 stereo .mp4 files.

phystech.p: As of April 4, 2014, all electronic files were accessible on a Intel Core 2 Duo CPU (2.33 GHz, 1.95 GB RAM) running Windows XP Professional Version 2002, with Service Pack 3. Software used to access the files includes Microsoft Office 2007, Firefox v. 21.0, and Adobe Reader XI.
The collection includes records in the following file formats:

separatedmaterial.head: Deaccession Information
separatedmaterial.p: With the permission of Council, Christel Maass removed from the collection on July 1, 2005 all rejected Midwestern Archivist and Archival Issues manuscripts and all accepted manuscripts that were withdrawn prior to publication. These were originally housed in boxes 92 through 97.

scopecontent.p: This record subgroup contains the files of MAC presidents, as well as some supporting documentation that precedes an individual's term in office. Files document MAC's founding in 1972 and Archie Motley's term as the first president of the organization. They also include records of subsequent presidents, such as correspondence; committee files; bi-annual meetings files; Council meeting materials; membership statistics, surveys, and questionnaires; and newsletter and journal files. The subgroup also documents issues of concern to the profession, such as the appointment of the Archivist of the United States, archival education, certification, MAC scholarships and awards, and developments in the field.

scopecontent.p: This record subgroup contains the files of MAC vice presidents. Prior to 1994, the vice president had limited responsbilities, which likely explains the absence of archival records from that period. In 1994, Council assigned the vice president responsibilities for serving as liaison and advisor to the program and local arrangements committees, and succeeding to the office of president should it be vacated. Researchers will find documentation relating to these topics in this subgroup.

did.unittitle: Special Meeting Committees and Task Forces, undated

scopecontent.p: This record subgroup contains records from both the Secretary and Treasurer prior to when the roles were split in 1991. Included are articles of incorporation, committee guidelines, constitution and bylaws, correspondence, financial reports, bi-annual meeting materials, and membership data, directories, and surveys.

Professional Rights and Responsibilities Statement, undated
Program Analysis Committee and Education Committee, 1979

scopecontent.p: This record subgroup contains records from the Secretary, primarily after the roles of the Secretary and Treasurer were split in 1991. Included are award, commitee, and correspondence files, a MAC chronology, and membership directories and membership statistics.

did.unittitle: "Do You Have Archival Issues?" Cartoon Copyright Agreement, 2012
National Coordinating Committee for the Promotion of History, 1985-1992

scopecontent.p: This record subgroup contains records from the Treasurer after the roles of the Secretary and Treasurer were split.

This record subgroup contains Council meeting materials, including minutes and materials discussed at the meetings. Records document the work of numerous committees and includes committee guidelines and reports, particularly reports regarding the planning of the bi-annual meetings. Included are financial reports, new member statistics, and editorial reports relating to the newsletter and the journal. Files also document issues of concern to the profession.

arrangement.p: Records are arranged by date of in-person Council meetings at the annual meeting (in spring) and symposium (fall). Records of Council meetings that occur between these meetings are arranged separately.

scopecontent.p: Minutes of the Annual Members' Meeting can also be found in the Spring meeting folders for 1994-2007.

This subgroup includes records from numerous committees. Most of the records consist of correspondence; committee guidelines, reports, and procedures; meeting minutes; and committee membership lists. The primary focus of many of these committees was the planning and evaluating of the bi-annual meetings. This subgroup also contains Nomination Committee materials and information pertaining to MAC elections and members, as well as Scholarship Committee files, which document the development of scholarships. The Twenty-fifth Anniversary Committee files primarily consist of e-mail messages between committee members, but also contain information pertinent to the history and founding of MAC. Records of the Local Arrangements and Program Committees are arranged in record subgroup 6.

did.unittitle: Special Projects Committee, Seminar on Regional Archival Systems, 1974-1975
Task Force on Archives and Society, 1985
Task Force to Review Constitution and By-Laws, 1992-1994

scopecontent.p: This subgroup contains materials pertaining to the spring and fall membership meetings. Files are arranged in chronological order by meeting, and then alphabetically by folder title. Included are Local Arrangement Committee files, Program Committee files, programs, and meeting handouts and packets. The Local Arrangement Committee files include minutes and reports, which document the committee's activities in the host city. Included are materials which document hotel planning, publicity, tours and activities, vendors and exhibits, and AV needs. The Program Committee files include minutes and reports of the committee responsible for planning sessions and contacting speakers. The meeting handouts and packets contain pocket programs, lists of attendees, and information about MAC activities and other activities in the host city. This record subgroup also includes scripts for the Raiders of the Lost Archives programs which MAC members performed at several MAC meetings.

did.unittitle: Local Arrangements Committee and Program Committee, 1982-1983
Raiders of the Lost Archives, II, 1986
Raiders of the Lost Archives, III, 1992

Raiders of the Lost Archives, IV, 1997

scopecontent.p: The MAC Calendars note dates of importance to archivists. Each month features a photograph from an archives in the MAC region.

Collection includes a complete set of MAC's semi-annual journal, The Midwestern Archivist (1976-1991) and Archival Issues (1992-present). Articles relate to archival theory and current practice, archival history, and aspects of related professions of interest to archivists, such as records management and conservation management. The journal also contains seminar proceedings, case studies, and book reviews.
Back issues of Archival Issues are available in MINDS@UW, the institutional repository of the University of Wisconsin System. The most recent full volume is embargoed for one year.

Collection includes a complete set of MAC newsletters. (N.B. Vol. 5, no. 4 was not published.) The newsletter provides information about meetings, committees, Council, repositories, publications, Web sites, members, awards, jobs, current issues, as well as other news related to the archives profession.

These records largely include correspondence with other board members and individuals who submitted articles for publication; and minutes and reports pertaining to the status of articles, book reviews, and the journal's production. Also included are files on advertising and production costs, review guidelines, and the journal's name change.

accessrestrict.p: Files pertaining to manuscript reviews are restricted for 15 years.

scopecontent.p: Files contain review forms, correspondence, and drafts of articles submitted for publication. Arranged by journal volume, these files also contain "Assignment of Rights" forms.

accessrestrict.p: These records are restricted for 15 years from the date of the review.

scopecontent.p: Newsletter Editorial Board files mainly consist of correspondence pertaining to newsletter articles, announcements, and columns, including the "Institutional Spotlight" column, which focused on a specific repository. Also included are newsletter reports and procedures.
Files contain publicity information, and include files pertaining to the MAC brochure, MAC logo, and awards.

scopecontent.p: Series includes photographs and slides, mostly of MAC members at various MAC meetings.

Series includes cassette and video tapes of Raiders of the Lost Archives productions from 1983 and 1986, and tapes from the Special Projects Committee Seminar on Regional Archival Systems held in July 1974.

did.abstract: Additions of records from Barbara Floyd, Archival Issues Editorial Board Chair, dating from 2011 to 2014. Files contain the manuscripts, correspondence, assignment of rights forms, and other items related to articles and book reviews accepted for publication in Archival Issues.
